alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; La Salle; Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:48PM CDT until May 08 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY FOR SOUTHERN DE KALB, LA SALLE AND LEE COUNTIES... At 948 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated isolated storm total rainfall of up to 4 inches in the warned area. Although the rainfall intensity has decreased to less than 0.5 inches per hour, some flooding may continue for the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations that may continue to experience flash flooding include... Ottawa, Peru, La Salle, Sandwich, Mendota, Marseilles, Amboy, Sheridan, Shabbona, Lake Holiday, Oglesby, Seneca, Somonauk, Earlville, Waterman, North Utica, Serena, Leland, Paw Paw and Grand Ridge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
